meanings.definition: To support or endorse a motion or proposal made by another person.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, I will be seconding Sarah's suggestion for a new project.
meanings.sent2: She was seconding the idea of having a team lunch every Friday.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed, seconding the dog's request for a walk.
meanings.sent4: The sun seconding the moon's decision to rise early that night.
meanings.sent5: The students cheered, seconding their classmate's call for a longer recess.

meanings.definition: The act of officially agreeing with or approving a decision or action.
meanings.sent1: His seconding of the proposal ensured its approval by the committee.
meanings.sent2: The seconding of the new policy was met with unanimous support.
meanings.sent3: The seconding of the cake at the party brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The seconding of the traffic light's green signal by all the cars was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The seconding of the movie choice by the group led to a fun movie night.
